About The People You‚Äôll See At RockPit
This is usually where you‚Äôll find some boring story about how our brewery came to fruition and how we all were homebrewers and couldn‚Äôt think of doing anything else for the rest of our lives.
And while that is certainly true, I‚Äôve decided instead to dedicate this page to the kick-ass people you‚Äôll run into at RockPit.
Hi, I‚Äôm Chris Rock (
scroll all the way down the page to see me
), one of the co-founders of RockPit Brewing and I want to introduce you to the people of RockPit in the best way possible; with bad glamour shots.
** Updated 5/23/24: this page is being updated daily until all of our new staff pics are revealed at
https://instagram.com/rockpitbrewing
You‚Äôll see Britt almost every day at Rockpit doing two things: Slinging drinks and petting dogs.
She is, without a doubt, the first person you‚Äôll encounter at Rockpit to ask, ‚ÄúCan I pet your dog?‚Äù
If you happen to see Britt outside of Rockpit (like in a cornfield), you‚Äôll most likely see her doing two things: Crushing Busch Lights and petting dogs. ü§£
Needless to say, she really, really, really, REALLY loves dogs.
So the next time you‚Äôre at Rockpit with your dog, don‚Äôt be surprised to see a smiling woman beelining towards you, asking if they can pet your dog.
Calista Rock (
@calistarock
) is our youngest bartender and my daughter. At any given moment, you‚Äôll catch Calista in this exact pose snapping a selfie behind the bar, in a coffee shop, or while driving down I-4.
When she‚Äôs not at RockPit slinging beer, she‚Äôs mentoring up-and-coming Instagram influencers on the optimal camera angle and facial expression to create the perfect profile pic for their LinkedIn, MySpace, or Geocities account to get them noticed ‚Äì no matter what speed your modem is (including 14.4 kbps). So give us your best
#badglamourshot
that you can feature on your own LinkedIn, Myspace or Geocities account.
Tammy Rock is my wife and one of the happiest people you‚Äôll ever meet. She always has an infectious smile on her face, loves chatting with you, getting to know you, and slinging beer your way.
She also LOVES to make you laugh. It‚Äôs one of her most charming features.
Tammy channeled her inner 80‚Äôs party animal and donned some jorts, frizzy hair in a bright pink scrunchie, over accentuated makeup, and of course, a Queen t-shirt. One of her all-time favorite bands.
Given a choice to go back in time, you‚Äôd catch her at Live Aid in 1985, screaming the lyrics to ‚ÄúRadio Ga Ga‚Äù at Wembley Stadium.
After the concert, she‚Äôd be pushing a keg of Rock Hard Water to the after-party where she‚Äôd no doubt be the center of attention.
Scott (
@pirate.jeezus
) is a veteran of the craft beer scene. He started at Tequesta Brewing Company 11 years ago, slinging drinks and cleaning tanks.
An excellent campfire guitar player (if you like Foo Fighters), he frequently travels to different cities to catch rock shows. Just be careful; the carnage he leaves behind after shredding the guitar can be catastrophic.
The next time you see him at Rockpit, check out the tattoos on his right arm. They reveal his favorite movie series.
Yeah, that‚Äôs me. And honestly, that‚Äôs how you‚Äôll see me most of the time. Shorts, t-shirt, hat and lots of sawdust all over me from building stuff. In fact, when you come in and sit at any of our tables or bar, I had a hand in building it.
I‚Äôm the marketing guy here at RockPit so I‚Äôm the one who convinces you to give us a try and gets you to come back over and over again. Mostly through the emails I send every week (
click here to sign up
). They‚Äôve been called ‚ÄúThe only email I read every week‚Äù by hundreds of our customers. My hope is that you feel like you‚Äôre not in Florida anymore when you walk through our doors and you‚Äôre treated like a family member.
If you feel like that didn‚Äôt happen, shoot me an email to
chris@rockpitbrewing.com
and let me know about it. I‚Äôll get it fixed for you.
Sean is our numbers cruncher and the one who ensures our crew and bills are paid. A pretty important part of keeping RockPit beer flowing your way.
I brewed my first beer ever with Sean. It was a Foster‚Äôs Lager clone that was absolutely delicious. After brewing the beer he told me ‚ÄúOne day, I‚Äôm going to open a brewery.‚Äù True to his word, we opened that brewery together eight years later.
You‚Äôll often catch Sean in the taproom chatting it up with regulars or teaching customers how to enjoy the sours brewed here at RockPit. It‚Äôs earned him the nickname ‚ÄúThe Sour Sherpa‚Äù.
